results.name: Triangle A000012(signed) * A007318 * A103451, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = A000012(signed) * A007318 * A103451 as infinite lower triangular matrices. A000012(signed) = (1; -1,1; 1,-1,1; ...).
T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor((n-1)/2)} binomial(n-2*j-1, k-1), with T(n,0) =
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
program: end if; return T; end function;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
else: return sum(binomial(n-2*j-1, k-1) for j in (0..floor((n-1)/2)))
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
